00001 #ifndef _LINKLIST_H_
00002 #define _LINKLIST_H_

00004 #if C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH

00010 
00011 /** A linklist element. This struct is provided for debugging convenience, 
00012     but should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice. 
00013 
00014     @ingroup linklist
00015     @see t_linklist
00016 */
00017 typedef struct _llelem
00018 {
00019     t_object        *thing;
00020     struct _llelem  *next;
00021     struct _llelem  *prev;
00022 } t_llelem;     
00023 
00024 
00025 /** The linklist object. This struct is provided for debugging convenience, 
00026     but should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice.
00027     
00028     @ingroup linklist
00029     @see t_llelem
00030 */
00031 typedef struct _linklist
00032 {
00033     t_object    ob;
00034     long        count;
00035     t_llelem    *head;
00036     t_llelem    *tail;
00037     long        readonly;
00038     void        *lock;
00039     t_llelem    *cache;         
00040     long        flags;
00041 } t_linklist;           
00042 
00043 #if C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH
00044     #pragma pack(pop)
00045 #elif C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK
00046     #pragma pack()
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 
00050 /**
00051     Comparison function pointer type.
00052     
00053     Methods that require a comparison function pointer to be passed in use this type.
00054     It should return <code>true</code> or <code>false</code> depending on the outcome of the 
00055     comparison of the two linklist items passed in as arguments.
00056     
00057     @ingroup datastore
00058     @see linklist_match()
00059     @see hashtab_findfirst()
00060     @see indexmap_sort()
00061 */
00062 typedef long (*t_cmpfn)(void *, void *);
00063 
00064 #ifdef __cplusplus
00065     extern "C" {
00066 #endif // __cplusplus
00067 
00068 
00069 // documented elsewhere
00070 void *object_method(void *x, t_symbol *s, ...);
00071 
00072 
00073 // private
00074 void c_linklist(void);

00076 
00077 /**
00078     Create a new linklist object.
00079     You can free the linklist by calling object_free() on the linklist's pointer,
00080     or by using linklist_chuck().
00081     
00082     @ingroup linklist
00083     @return  Pointer to the new linklist object.
00084     
00085     @see                object_free()
00086     @see                linklist_chuck()
00087 */
00088 t_linklist *linklist_new(void);
00089 
00090 
00091 /** 
00092     Free a linklist, but don't free the items it contains.
00093     
00094     The linklist can contain a variety of different types of data.
00095     By default, the linklist assumes that all items are max objects with a valid
00096     #t_object header.
00097     
00098     You can alter the linklist's notion of what it contains by using the 
00099     linklist_flags() method.
00100     
00101     When you free the linklist by calling object_free() it then tries to free all of the items it contains.  
00102     If the linklist is storing a custom type of data, or should otherwise not free the data it contains,
00103     then call linklist_chuck() to free the object instead of object_free().
00104     
00105     @ingroup linklist
00106     @param  x   The linklist object to be freed.
00107     @see object_free
00108 */
00109 void linklist_chuck(t_linklist *x); 
00110 
00111 
00112 /**
00113     Return the number of items in a linklist object.
00114     
00115     @ingroup linklist
00116     
00117     @param  x   The linklist instance.
00118     @return     The number of items in the linklist object.
00119 */
00120 long linklist_getsize(t_linklist *x);
00121 
00122 
00123 /**
00124     Return the item stored in a linklist at a specified index.
00125     
00126     @ingroup linklist
00127     
00128     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00129     @param  index   The index in the linklist to fetch.  Indices are zero-based.
00130     @return         The item from the linklist stored at index.  
00131                     If there is no item at the index, <code>NULL</code> is returned
00132 */
00133 void *linklist_getindex(t_linklist *x, long index);

00140 // private
00141 long linklist_ptr2index(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p);

00144 /**
00145     Return an item's index, given the item itself.
00146     
00147     @ingroup linklist
00148     
00149     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00150     @param  p       The item pointer to search for in the linklist.
00151     @return         The index of the item given in the linklist.  
00152                     If the item is not in the linklist #MAX_ERR_GENERIC is returned.
00153 */
00154 long linklist_objptr2index(t_linklist *x, void *p);

00157 /**
00158     Add an item to the end of the list.
00159     
00160     @ingroup linklist
00161     
00162     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00163     @param  o       The item pointer to append to the linked-list.
00164     @return         The index of the item in the linklist.
00165 */
00166 long linklist_append(t_linklist *x, void *o);

00169 /** Insert an item into the list at the specified index.
00170     @ingroup linklist
00171     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00172     @param  o       The item pointer to insert.
00173     @param  index   The index at which to insert.  Index 0 is the head of the list.
00174     @return         The index of the item in the linklist, or -1 if the insert failed.
00175 */
00176 long linklist_insertindex(t_linklist *x,  void *o, long index);
00177 
00178 
00179 /** Insert an item into the list, keeping the list sorted according to a specified comparison function.
00180     @ingroup        linklist
00181     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00182     @param  o       The item pointer to insert.
00183     @param  cmpfn   A comparison function by which the list should be sorted.
00184     @return         The index of the new item in the linklist, or -1 if the insert failed.
00185 */
00186 long linklist_insert_sorted(t_linklist *x, void *o, long cmpfn(void *, void *));

00189 /**
00190     Insert an item into the list after another specified item.
00191     
00192     @ingroup linklist

00195     @param  o       The item pointer to insert.
00196     @param  objptr  The item pointer after which to insert in the list.
00197     
00198     @return         An opaque linklist element.
00199 */
00200 t_llelem *linklist_insertafterobjptr(t_linklist *x, void *o, void *objptr); // inserts object o after objptr

00247 
00248 
00249 /**
00250     Remove the item from the list at the specified index and free it.
00251     
00252     The linklist can contain a variety of different types of data.
00253     By default, the linklist assumes that all items are max objects with a valid
00254     #t_object header.  Thus by default, it frees items by calling object_free() on them.
00255 
00256     You can alter the linklist's notion of what it contains by using the 
00257     linklist_flags() method.
00258 
00259     If you wish to remove an item from the linklist and free it yourself, then you
00260     should use linklist_chuckptr().
00261     
00262     @ingroup linklist
00263     
00264     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00265     @param  index   The index of the item to delete.
00266     @return         Returns #MAX_ERR_NONE on successful deletion, otherwise returns #MAX_ERR_GENERIC
00267     
00268     @see            linklist_chuckindex
00269     @see            linklist_chuckobject
00270 */
00271 long linklist_deleteindex(t_linklist *x, long index); 
00272 
00273 
00274 /**
00275     Remove the item from the list at the specified index.
00276     
00277     You are responsible for freeing any memory associated with the item that is
00278     removed from the linklist.
00279     
00280     @ingroup linklist
00281     
00282     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00283     @param  index   The index of the item to remove.
00284     @return         Returns #MAX_ERR_NONE on successful removal, otherwise returns #MAX_ERR_GENERIC
00285     
00286     @see            linklist_deleteindex
00287     @see            linklist_chuckobject
00288 */
00289 long linklist_chuckindex(t_linklist *x, long index);
00290 
00291 
00292 /**
00293     Remove the specified item from the list.
00294     
00295     You are responsible for freeing any memory associated with the item that is
00296     removed from the linklist.
00297     
00298     @ingroup linklist
00299     
00300     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00301     @param  o       The pointer to the item to remove.
00302     @return         Returns #MAX_ERR_NONE on successful removal, otherwise returns #MAX_ERR_GENERIC
00303     
00304     @see            linklist_deleteindex
00305     @see            linklist_chuckindex
00306 */
00307 void linklist_chuckobject(t_linklist *x, void *o);
00308 
00309 
00310 // private
00311 long linklist_deleteptr(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p);
00312 
00313 
00314 // private
00315 long linklist_chuckptr(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p); //like delete, but don't free it
00316 
00317 
00318 /**
00319     Remove and free all items in the list.
00320     
00321     Freeing items in the list is subject to the same rules as linklist_deleteindex().
00322     You can alter the linklist's notion of what it contains, and thus how items are freed,
00323     by using the linklist_flags() method.   
00324 
00325     @ingroup    linklist    
00326     @param      x           The linklist instance.
00327 */
00328 void linklist_clear(t_linklist *x);
00329

00332 long linklist_insertnodeindex(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p, long index);

00335 t_llelem *linklist_insertnodeptr(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p1, t_llelem *p2);
00336

00338 long linklist_appendnode(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *p);

00340 // private
00341 t_llelem *linklistelem_new(t_linklist *x);

00344 void linklistelem_free(t_linklist *x, t_llelem *elem);

00347 /**
00348     Retrieve linklist items as an array of pointers.
00349     
00350     @ingroup linklist
00351     
00352     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00353     @param  a       The address of the first pointer in the array to fill.
00354     @param  max     The number of pointers in the array.
00355     @return         The number of items from the list actually returned in the array.
00356 */
00357 long linklist_makearray(t_linklist *x, void **a, long max);

00376 void linklist_rotate(t_linklist *x, long i);

00385 void linklist_shuffle(t_linklist *x);

00388 /**
00389     Swap the position of two items in the linked-list, specified by index.
00390 
00391     @ingroup linklist   
00392     @param  x   The linklist instance.
00393     @param  a   The index of the first item to swap.
00394     @param  b   The index of the second item to swap.
00395 */
00396 void linklist_swap(t_linklist *x, long a, long b);
00397 
00398 
00399 /**
00400     Search the linked list for the first item meeting defined criteria.
00401     The items in the list are traversed, calling a specified comparison function on each
00402     until the comparison function returns true.  
00403 
00404     @ingroup linklist   
00405     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00406     @param  o       The address to pointer that will be set with the matching item.
00407     @param  cmpfn   The function used to determine a match in the list.
00408     @param  cmpdata An argument to be passed to the #t_cmpfn.  
00409                     This will be passed as the second of the two args to the #t_cmpfn.  
00410                     The first arg will be the linklist item at each iteration in the list.
00411     @return         The index of the matching item, or -1 if no match is found.
00412     
00413     @remark     The following shows how to manually do what linklist_chuckobject() does.  
00414     @code
00415     void *obj;
00416     long index;
00417     
00418     index = linklist_findfirst(x, &obj, #linklist_match, o);
00419     if(index != -1)
00420         linklist_chuckindex(x, index);
00421     @endcode
00422     
00423     @see linklist_match
00424     @see t_cmpfn
00425     @see linklist_findall
00426 */
00427 long linklist_findfirst(t_linklist *x, void **o, long cmpfn(void *, void *), void *cmpdata);
00428 
00429 
00430 /**
00431     Search the linked list for all items meeting defined criteria.
00432     The items in the list are traversed, calling a specified comparison function on each,
00433     and returning the matches in another linklist.
00434 
00435     @ingroup linklist   
00436     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00437     @param  out     The address to a #t_linklist pointer.  
00438                     You should initialize the pointer to NULL before calling linklist_findall(). 
00439                     A new linklist will be created internally by linklist_findall() and returned here.
00440     @param  cmpfn   The function used to determine a match in the list.
00441     @param  cmpdata An argument to be passed to the #t_cmpfn.  
00442                     This will be passed as the second of the two args to the #t_cmpfn.  
00443                     The first arg will be the linklist item at each iteration in the list.
00444     
00445     @remark     The following example assumes you have a linklist called myLinkList, and #t_cmpfn called 
00446                 myCmpFunction, and some sort of data to match in someCriteria.
00447     @code
00448     t_linklist *results = NULL;
00449     
00450     linklist_findall(myLinkList, &results, myCmpFunction, (void *)someCriteria);
00451     // do something here with the 'results' linklist
00452     // then free the results linklist
00453     linklist_chuck(results);
00454     @endcode
00455     
00456     @see    linklist_match
00457     @see    t_cmpfn
00458     @see    linklist_findfirst
00459 */
00460 void linklist_findall(t_linklist *x, t_linklist **out, long cmpfn(void *, void *), void *cmpdata);
00461 
00462 
00463 /**
00464     Call the named message on every object in the linklist.  
00465     The linklist_methodall() function requires that all items in the linklist are
00466     object instances with a valid t_object header.
00467 
00468     @ingroup linklist   
00469     @param  x   The linklist instance.
00470     @param  s   The name of the message to send to the objects.
00471     @param  ... Any arguments to be sent with the message.
00472     
00473     @remark     Internally, this function uses object_method(), meaning that no errors will be
00474                 posted if the message name does not exist for the object.  It also means that
00475                 messages sent methods with #A_GIMME definitions will need to be given a symbol 
00476                 argument prior to the argc and argv array information.
00477 */
00478 void linklist_methodall(t_linklist *x, t_symbol *s, ...);
00479 
00480 
00481 /**
00482     Call the named message on an object specified by index.  
00483     The item must be an object instance with a valid t_object header.
00484 
00485     @ingroup linklist   
00486     @param  x   The linklist instance.
00487     @param  i   The index of the item to which to send the message.
00488     @param  s   The name of the message to send to the objects.
00489     @param  ... Any arguments to be sent with the message.
00490     
00491     @remark     Internally, this function uses object_method(), meaning that no errors will be
00492                 posted if the message name does not exist for the object.  It also means that
00493                 messages sent methods with #A_GIMME definitions will need to be given a symbol 
00494                 argument prior to the argc and argv array information.
00495 */
00496 void *linklist_methodindex(t_linklist *x, long i, t_symbol *s, ...);
00497 
00498 
00499 /**
00500     Sort the linked list.  
00501     The items in the list are ordered using a #t_cmpfn function that is passed in as an argument.
00502 
00503     @ingroup linklist   
00504     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00505     @param  cmpfn   The function used to sort the list.
00506     
00507     @remark     The following is example is a real-world example of sorting a linklist of symbols alphabetically
00508                 by first letter only.  First the cmpfn is defined, then it is used in a different function
00509                 by linklist_sort().
00510     @code
00511     long myAlphabeticalCmpfn(void *a, void *b)
00512     {
00513         t_symbol *s1 = (t_symbol *)a;
00514         t_symbol *s2 = (t_symbol *)b;
00515 
00516         if(s1->s_name[0] < s2->s_name[0])
00517             return true;
00518         else
00519             return false;
00520     }
00521     
00522     void mySortMethod(t_myobj *x)
00523     {
00524         // the linklist was already created and filled with items previously 
00525         linklist_sort(x->myLinkList, myAlphabeticalCmpfn);
00526     }
00527     @endcode
00528 */
00529 void linklist_sort(t_linklist *x, long cmpfn(void *, void *));
00530 
00531 
00532 /**
00533     Call the specified function for every item in the linklist.  
00534 
00535     @ingroup linklist   
00536     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00537     @param  fun     The function to call, specified as function pointer cast to a Max #method.
00538     @param  arg     An argument that you would like to pass to the function being called.
00539     
00540     @remark         The linklist_funall() method will call your function for every item in the list.
00541                     It will pass both a pointer to the item in the list, and any argument that you
00542                     provide.  The following example shows a function that could be called by linklist_funall().
00543     @code
00544     void myFun(t_object *myObj, void *myArg)
00545     {
00546         // do something with myObj and myArg here
00547         // myObj is the item in the linklist
00548     }
00549     @endcode
00550 */
00551 void linklist_funall(t_linklist *x, method fun, void *arg);
00552 
00553 
00554 /**
00555     Call the specified function for every item in the linklist.  
00556     The iteration through the list will halt if the function returns a non-zero value.
00557 
00558     @ingroup linklist   
00559     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00560     @param  fun     The function to call, specified as function pointer cast to a Max #method.
00561     @param  arg     An argument that you would like to pass to the function being called.
00562     
00563     @remark         The linklist_funall() method will call your function for every item in the list.
00564                     It will pass both a pointer to the item in the list, and any argument that you
00565                     provide.  The following example shows a function that could be called by linklist_funall().
00566     @code
00567     long myFun(t_symbol *myListItemSymbol, void *myArg)
00568     {
00569         // this function is called by a linklist that contains symbols for its items
00570         if(myListItemSymbol == gensym("")){
00571             error("empty symbol -- aborting linklist traversal")
00572             return 1;           
00573         }
00574         else{
00575             // do something with the symbol
00576             return 0;
00577         }
00578     }
00579     @endcode
00580 */
00581 long linklist_funall_break(t_linklist *x, method fun, void *arg);
00582 
00583 
00584 /**
00585     Call the specified function for an item specified by index.  
00586 
00587     @ingroup linklist   
00588     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00589     @param  i       The index of the item to which to send the message.
00590     @param  fun     The function to call, specified as function pointer cast to a Max #method.
00591     @param  arg     An argument that you would like to pass to the function being called.
00592     
00593     @remark         The linklist_funindex() method will call your function for an item in the list.
00594                     It will pass both a pointer to the item in the list, and any argument that you
00595                     provide.  The following example shows a function that could be called by linklist_funindex().
00596     @code
00597     void myFun(t_object *myObj, void *myArg)
00598     {
00599         // do something with myObj and myArg here
00600         // myObj is the item in the linklist
00601     }
00602     @endcode
00603 */
00604 void *linklist_funindex(t_linklist *x, long i, method fun, void *arg);
00605 
00606 
00607 /**
00608     Given an item in the list, replace it with a different value.
00609 
00610     @ingroup linklist   
00611     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00612     @param  p       An item in the list.
00613     @param  newp    The new value.
00614     @return         Always returns NULL.
00615 */
00616 void *linklist_substitute(t_linklist *x, void *p, void *newp);
00617 
00618 
00619 /**
00620     Given an item in the list, find the next item.
00621     This provides an means for walking the list.
00622 
00623     @ingroup linklist   
00624     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00625     @param  p       An item in the list.
00626     @param  next    The address of a pointer to set with the next item in the list.
00627 */
00628 void *linklist_next(t_linklist *x, void *p, void **next);
00629 
00630 
00631 /**
00632     Given an item in the list, find the previous item.
00633     This provides an means for walking the list.
00634 
00635     @ingroup linklist   
00636     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00637     @param  p       An item in the list.
00638     @param  prev    The address of a pointer to set with the previous item in the list.
00639 */
00640 void *linklist_prev(t_linklist *x, void *p, void **prev);
00641 
00642 
00643 /**
00644     Return the last item (the tail) in the linked-list.
00645     
00646     @ingroup linklist
00647     @param  x       The linklist instance.
00648     @param  item    The address of pointer in which to store the last item in the linked-list.
00649     @return         always returns NULL
00650 */
00651 void *linklist_last(t_linklist *x, void **item);
00652 
00653 
00654 /**
00655     Set the linklist's readonly bit.
00656     
00657     By default the readonly bit is 0, indicating that it is threadsafe for both reading and writing.
00658     Setting the readonly bit to 1 will disable the linklist's theadsafety mechanism, increasing 
00659     performance but at the expense of threadsafe operation.  
00660     Unless you can guarantee the threading context for a linklist's use, you should leave this set to 0.
00661     
00662     @ingroup linklist
00663     @param  x           The linklist instance.
00664     @param  readonly    A 1 or 0 for setting the readonly bit.
00665 */
00666 void linklist_readonly(t_linklist *x, long readonly);
00667 
00668 
00669 /**
00670     Set the linklist's datastore flags.  The available flags are enumerated in #e_max_datastore_flags.
00671     These flags control the behavior of the linklist, particularly when removing items from the list
00672     using functions such as linklist_clear(), linklist_deleteindex(), or when freeing the linklist itself.
00673     
00674     @ingroup linklist
00675     @param  x           The linklist instance.
00676     @param  flags   A valid value from the #e_max_datastore_flags.  The default is #OBJ_FLAG_OBJ.
00677 */
00678 void linklist_flags(t_linklist *x, long flags);
00679 
00680 
00681 /**
00682     Get the linklist's datastore flags.
00683         
00684     @ingroup linklist
00685     @param  x   The linklist instance.
00686     @return     The current state of the linklist flags as enumerated in #e_max_datastore_flags.
00687 */
00688 long linklist_getflags(t_linklist *x);
00689 
00690 
00691 /**
00692     A linklist comparison method that determines if two item pointers are equal.
00693     
00694     @ingroup linklist
00695     
00696     @param  a       The first item to compare.
00697     @param  b       The second item to compare.
00698     @return         Returns 1 if the items are equal, otherwise 0.
00699     
00700     @see            t_cmpfn 
00701 */
00702 long linklist_match(void *a, void *b);
00703 
00704 
00705 #ifdef __cplusplus
00706 }
00707 #endif // __cplusplus
00708 
00709 #endif // _LINKLIST_H_
